title: Oral hygiene (after feeding)
description: Brush or clean baby's teeth/gums after each feeding.

title: Bathing
description: Give baby a bath daily.

title: Wash and sterilize bottles, pacifiers, and other feeding utensils
description: Clean and sterilize all feeding items daily.

title: Supplement Vitamin D
description: Give baby the recommended daily dose of Vitamin D.

title: Trim fingernails and toenails
description: Trim baby's nails 1-2 times per week.

title: Rotate toys for display
description: Rotate baby's toys 1-2 times per week to maintain interest.

title: Clean and sanitize baby toys
description: Clean and sanitize all toys weekly.

title: Change and wash bedding and linens
description: Change and wash baby's bedding weekly.

title: Trim hair (if necessary to keep out of eyes/ears)
description: Trim baby's hair every 4-8 weeks if needed.

title: Check clothing sizes and purchase new clothes
description: Check baby's clothing sizes and purchase new clothes every 3 months.

title: 1 month Check-up
description: Routine check-up at 1 month.

title: 2 months Vaccines
description: DTaP-IPV-Hib-HB, Pneumococcal conjugate vaccine, Rotavirus

title: 4 months Vaccines
description: DTaP-IPV-Hib-HB, Pneumococcal conjugate vaccine, Meningococcal conjugate (MenconC), Rotavirus

title: 6 months Vaccines
description: DTaP-IPV-Hib-HB, Pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (high risk children only)

title: Influenza Vaccine
description: Influenza 2 for children 6 months and older, annually during October to February

title: 9 months Check-up
description: Routine 9-month check-up.

title: 12 months Vaccines
description: MMR-Var 3, Meningococcal conjugate (MenconC), Pneumococcal conjugate vaccine

title: 18 months Vaccines
description: DTaP-IPV-Hib, MMR-Var 3

title: 24 months Check-up
description: Routine 24-month check-up.

title: 30 months Check-up
description: Routine 30-month check-up.

title: 36 months Check-up
description: Routine 36-month check-up.

title: 48 months Check-up
description: Tdap-IPV 4

title: Leap 1: World of Changing Sensations
description: The baby begins to notice more external stimuli; their perception of the outside world starts to change.
notes: Cries more often; Becomes clingy and wants skin contact; Difficulty sleeping

title: Leap 2: World of Patterns
description: The baby starts recognizing fixed patterns using their senses; begins to differentiate themselves from the surrounding world.
notes: Demands more attention; Cries more often; Clingy; Poor appetite; Sucks thumb or fingers

title: Leap 3: World of Smooth Transitions
description: The baby's movements become less jerky; their senses are better attuned to subtle details.
notes: Quieter than usual; Poor sleep; Clingy; Poor appetite

title: Leap 4: World of Events
description: The baby develops a concept of sequence in events (e.g., reaching for a toy, examining it, putting it in their mouth).
notes: Demands more attention; Cries more often; Clingy; Big mood swings; Head may drop

title: Leap 5: World of Relationships
description: Starts understanding distance between objects and people; begins to grasp simple cause-and-effect relationships.
notes: Demands more attention; Poor sleep; Clingy; Crankier/cries more often; Dislikes diaper changes

title: Leap 6: World of Categories
description: The baby starts to understand that items can be grouped into different categories (e.g., food, toys).
notes: Demands more attention; Poor sleep; May cling tightly to your clothing; Regresses to baby-like behaviors; May be quieter than usual

title: Leap 7: World of Sequences
description: The baby recognizes the importance of order and how to assemble things.
notes: Shyer with strangers; Big mood swings; Jealousy; Poor sleep; Regresses to baby-like behaviors; May be quieter than usual

title: Leap 8: World of Programs
description: The baby's understanding of sequence evolves to grasp that a goal can be achieved through different methods/programs.
notes: Big mood swings; Jealousy; Poor sleep; Regresses to baby-like behaviors; May daydream; May be very mischievous; Poor appetite

title: Leap 9: World of Principles
description: The baby starts contemplating how to achieve goals; begins to make choices and develops a basic concept of consequences.
notes: Wants more physical contact; Shyer with strangers; Wants to be entertained; Big mood swings; Poor sleep; Regresses to baby-like behaviors

title: Leap 10: World of Systems
description: The baby can understand and distinguish between different systems; begins to develop a strong sense of self and identity.
notes: Clingy; Shyer with strangers; Jealousy; Big mood swings; Poor sleep; Regresses to baby-like behaviors
